page.title: 10The Local People
page.content:
There is very little industry in the area. Infact the industry that does exist is with farming. An example of this is the dairy.
The only big housing area is found on the eastern edge of the grid. Here there are council housing estates. These form the edge of Bath.
At the present there are two problems that concern the people living in this country area. One is the closure of the village school in Englishcombe. The school is due to close at the end of the summer term 1985. The other problem concerns dairy farming, described elsewhere in the survey.
